summary: Water quality is stable but requires monitoring due to slight pH drop and temperature deviation.

insights.recommendation: Monitor pH closely; consider adding buffers if it drops below 7.0.
Check for any accumulation of solids; perform partial water change if TDS continues to rise.
Ensure temperature remains stable; consider heating if it drops below 22°C.

extended_notes:
Last 7 days overview:
• pH avg/min/max: 7.036 / 7.016 / 7.088 (trend: down)
• TDS avg/min/max: 318.837 / 295.1 / 347.6 ppm (trend: down)
• Temp avg/min/max: 26.268 / 23.56 / 30.44 °C (trend: down)

Actions (if needed):
• pH: keep ~6.6–7.2; calibrate probe with 7.00/4.01; adjust slowly.
• TDS: seedlings ~200–500 ppm; higher OK for mature plants; water-change to reduce.
• Temp: hold in target band for your fish/plants; heater/chiller/aeration as needed.
